title: Wedding invitation fancy script
content:
Two questions. First, can anyone ID the face used here? The second is, can anyone suggest a foundry that has similar fonts or specific fonts like this? thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122103130im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/sample_5690.jpg)

 [‹ What font?](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122103130/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48715 "Go to previous forum topic") [CNN debate's imposing lanky awkward gothic ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122103130/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42306 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jasonf

comments.content: Last year I used Bickham Script Pro for a wedding invitation. The font above doesn’t look like Bickham, but appears to have a large variety of swash characters just the same. I purchased from myfonts.com
Don’t think this is a font. Looks handwritten. Too many alternative letterforms.
As for your second question: Check out [Sudtipos’ Bluemlein Script Collection (Miss Fajardose especially)](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122103130/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts/69).

This is definitely handwritten. I know you asked for fonts, but if you’re interested, it’s the work of calligrapher [Laura Hooper](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122103130/http:/www.lhcalligraphy.com/invitations/lucky_orchid_set_14.htm).

Yeah I figured it was handwritten, and I knew it was by Laura Hooper. Thanks for your help all.

jason
